intro: Dissanthelium longiligulatum, commonly known as the long-awned panic grass, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with elongated bristles, which are a distinguishing feature. It typically thrives in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and marshes. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to wetland environments, making it an important component of these ecosystems.
